shortDescription: The Directorate has hidden the atomic warheads from House Espinosa's nuclear program under a network of processors and silos, but the Restoration has lost control of that area. Former Director Espinosa has been on the run since the fall of Coromodir and it's likely that he might be hiding on that area, according to Colonel Haust's intelligence, so we're being sent to check it out and recover the nukes.
longDescription: The stuff that they mine on Itrom is worth a small fortune on the black market. Better to have it in our hands than the Directorate's.

contractObjectiveList.title: Take advantage of Itrom's sensor interference to approach Directorate units unseen
Eliminate Directorate 'Mechs to secure resource storage silos
Act quickly to prevent the Directorate from sabotaging the silos

objectiveList.title: TAKE CONTROL OF AT LEAST ONE STORAGE SILO
DESTROY FORCES AT SILO ALPHA BEFORE IT SELF DESTRUCTS
DESTROY FORCES AT SILO ALPHA BEFORE IT SELF DESTRUCTS
Destroy the units Defending Silo Bravo
DESTROY FORCES AT SILO BRAVO BEFORE IT SELF DESTRUCTS
Destroy the units Defending Silo Charlie
DESTROY FORCES AT SILO CHARLIE BEFORE IT SELF DESTRUCTS

dialogueContent.words: While capturing one working silo is your primary objective, we can always use more. The Restoration will pay an additional bounty for each silo you capture beyond the first. Good hunting, Commander.

The same radiation that's garbling the Directorate's long-range communications will render their sensors useless. You can detect them, but they won't even know you're there until you enter their direct line of sight.
With the radiation masking your approach, you'll be like ghosts to the Directorate. Plan your moves carefully, close to striking distance, and take them down.
Nicely done, Commander—the storage silo is ours. I'm marking an evac zone on your map; whenever you're ready, you may proceed there for extraction.
Our recovery team is moving in to take possession of the silo.
You're getting close, Commander. Be careful with your positioning—if they pick up a visual on you, they'll go on high alert, sensors or no sensors.
Lock and load, Bravo Lance! We've got company!
Silo Bravo has detected you. Move fast, Commander—you have a limited time before they destroy the silo.
Alpha Lance, fall in on my position! I've got eyes on the enemy!
Silo Alpha has detected your presence. Act quickly, Commander—if you give them enough time, they'll set the silo to self-destruct.
Weapons hot, Charlie Lance! We've got incoming BattleMechs at my position!
Silo Charlie is under alert. Take it quickly, before they have time to destroy it.
Hurry, Commander! They’ve nearly finished wiring the silo to blow!
It's too late—we've lost this silo.

Commander, I'm detecting Directorate reinforcements between you and the evac point. They won't be able to find you unless you enter their line of sight, but it looks like you're going to have to fight your way through them.
Hurry, Commander! They've almost finished rigging that silo to blow!
Time is almost up, either defeat those guards or get your forces clear!
That silo is almost ready to blow!
Engineers deployed, they're defusing the charges now.
We've set down combat engineers, they're securing the structure.
Explosive defusal is a go, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}.
Good work, Commander—thanks to you, the Directorate has suffered a major setback, and we've gained a valuable new asset.
Yeah, three cheers. If you'll excuse us, Lady Arano, we need to get these 'Mechs hosed down and decontaminated. C'mon, Commander… Yang's got a great big tub of boron, and he's just dying to use it.
Commander, the area has been cleared. Darius has given me the green light to land immediately. Hold position.

Welcome to the badlands of Itrom, Commander. The sands of this desert are rich in exotic elements that play havoc with electronic sensors and communications. Without the use of House Gallas's signal-boosting equipment, you wouldn't even be receiving this message.

The badlands are a gold mine of rare-earth metals and fissile materials. The Directorate has seized control of House Gallas's largest processor and refinery, and they're getting ready to move a year's supply of exotic materials offworld.

I need you to capture at least one of those silos for the Restoration. Choose your target, engage its defenders, and destroy them—our recovery team will take care of the rest. You’ll need to act quickly, though; the Directorate will wire the silos to self-destruct if you give them the chance.

The same radiation that's garbling the Directorate's long-range communications will render their sensors useless. You can detect them, but they won't even know you're there until you enter their direct line of sight, and the silos won't be able to communicate with one another.

Because of this, I'd advise you to engage the silos one at a time—choose a target and clear it of defenders before moving on to the next. If you're careful, you'll be able to hit all three silos, one after the other, and the Directorate's troops will be none the wiser.
Good work, Commander—thanks to you, the Directorate has suffered a major setback, and we've gained a valuable new asset.
Yeah, three cheers. If you'll excuse us, Lady Arano, we need to get these 'Mechs hosed down and decontaminated. C'mon, Commander… Yang's got a great big tub of boron, and he's just dying to use it.
